title: CS Practical Competency Enhancement: Web-Based Training (WBT) Design Using Collaborative Authorship Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic web tool proficiency and advanced knowledge in sociology
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Apply the three-stage collaborative authorship methodology (macro-design, micro-design, development) to structure WBT (Web-Based Training) content.
Organize the logical flow of learning content using a classification system based on Rhetorical Structure Theory (RST).

Using a RACI matrix (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed), learners clearly assign roles among team members, complete a web-based educational material production process (2 videos, 1 PDF) within a 6-month course, and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least four of five team evaluation items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
